result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob J Dickinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: *Credit for 3 days time served, straight time.
*Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
*Restitution set at ZERO.
*Provide DNA Sample.

*No contact with firearms.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.
*No VIOLENT contact with victim Mazie W.

*Batterers Intervention program.
*Parenting classes.
*Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

*AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob J Dickinson

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacob J Dickinson in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 45 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days time served, straight time.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No VIOLENT contact with victim Mazie W.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Restitution set at ZERO.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Probation Review Hearing in branch 24.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Jacob J Dickinson in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Judge Kremers is hearing this case for Judge Protasiewicz.
 Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Case adjourned back to Branch 24 for sentencing.
Jury trial date of 03/02/2016 vacated.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Branch 24 in trial on today's date. This case to be transferred to branch 36 for purposes of plea/sentencing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jacob J Dickinson in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case remains scheduled for Jury Trial on 3/2/2016 at 8:30 am. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.
Victim requesting modification of the No Contact order to a No Violent Contact order. Court orders the No Violent Contact order with the Mazie W. and their children.

Defendant Jacob J Dickinson in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Discussion of no contact order placed on the record. Case remains scheduled for Final Pretrial on 2/10/2016 at 8:30 and Jury Trial on 3/2/2016 at 8:30 am. Case adjourned to branch 24.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.
Defense requesting modification of the No Contact order to a No Violent Contact order.  State opposes.  Court orders the No Contact order to remain.

Defendant Jacob J Dickinson in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Hearing on no contact order, Final Pretrial, and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Hearing on no contact order scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Mazie W., MM (8/31/01), BD (5/24/12), and CD (2/14/15).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jacob J Dickinson in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Jacob J Dickinson in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
